data.title: No Customer Service
data.text: I went to the My Place restaurant in Edinburg this past Tuesday. I ordered the carne guisada plate.  It took a while for my food to arrive. When it finally arrived my plate looked terrible. There were about 8 small pieces of meat on the plate. I mentioned to the server if this was normal and after looking at the plate she stated she would bring me some additional meat. Well as I started to eat the carne guisada which was not very tasty and lacked seasoning. The beans were not fresh; they were probably old beans that were a little sour. The rice didn't have any flavor either and they threw some lettuce and a little tomato on the plate to make it look full. Anyway, our server never came back to bring me the extra carne guisada, to refill our drinks or to see how we were doing. When I went to pay my tab at the register, I mentioned my complete displeasure to the lady and explained what had happened. She didn't seem to care one iota. After I saw her reaction and demeanor I mentioned to her that I would not be coming back and she didn't even blink. I can't see this establishment lasting too much longer if this continues.

data.title: It's ok
data.text: Their lunch specials are good. The food is not always great. I have visited this place more than once and it seems like the more I went to it, the less and less I wanted to eat there. The last time I was there, there was a plastic lid inside the bowl of salsa. They always seem like they are in a huge rush. I understand that it's the lunch rush hour, but no need to rush the food either. That is how you end up messing up the food and orders. I would recommend you try it once.

data.title: Good breakfast
data.text: Great atmosphere and you run into lots of friends and can't help but catching up. Service is good and so is the food.

data.title: Dining at My Place Cafe
data.text: Recently dined at My Place Cafe. The place has been renovated, remodeled. Appears more spaceous, open concept. They have good Mexican food. The service is good, depending on the size of your party.

data.title: Excellent and Cheap!
data.text: This place is under new management. Someone in the kitchen knows how to cook.  Excellent variety of Mexican border food.  Side dishes are particularly noteworthy.  Dishes appear homemade and freshly cooked. Lunch specials were $4.99 today! For three crispy corn tortilla tacos, refried beans, and rice.

data.title: Great food and friendly service
data.text: We shared a plate which was large enough for two.  Very good service and friendly atmosphere.  Across the street from the Museum of South Texas History.
